body: When you call a function in Python, the program will execute the function, then resume its progress where the function was called. In your case, calling input_state() does not "loop", it just calls it once, and then goes to the next line, which is the end of the program. You want to have use a while loop that checks everytime if it should run. Also, use if another.lower() == 'y' instead of if (another == y) or (another == Y).
title: How to call a user defined function from an if statement
